Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a fish and label it as an animal.
The student can draw and label the fish's habitat, such as a pond or ocean.
The student can draw and label water and plants in the habitat, showing understanding of what elements are essential for the fish.
The student can depict other living things in the habitat, like plants or other aquatic animals, although labels may sometimes be incomplete.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label what the fish needs to survive, like food sources (e.g., labels may be missing or vaguely defined).
The student might show an incomplete understanding of how the fish and its habitat work together as a system (e.g., not clearly illustrating interactions between the fish and plants).
